com.st.st25sdk.type5.st25dv

Class ST25DVTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.NFCTag
      • com.st.st25sdk.type5.Type5Tag
        • com.st.st25sdk.type5.STType5Tag
          • com.st.st25sdk.type5.STType5MultiAreaTag
            • com.st.st25sdk.type5.st25dv.ST25DVTag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CacheInterface, CCFileInterface, NdefCommandInterface, FastTransferModeInterface, MultiAreaInterface, RegisterInterface, SysFileInterface, STType5PasswordInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ST25TVHighDensityTag, ST25TVPTag

    public class ST25DVTag
extends STType5MultiAreaTag
implements STType5PasswordInterface, MultiAreaInterface, RegisterInterface, FastTransferModeInterface
    Provide implementation of ST25DV Dynamic tags with access to main features such as: - Password management - Area configuration - Fast Transfer Mode with Read/Write/Configuration functions - NDEF functions related - Tag informations - Type5Tag commands and custom commands - CC file - System file

        public byte writeMultipleBlock(int blockAddress,
                               byte[] buffer)
                        throws STException
        Writes the complete buffer in EEPROM at the specified block address. The buffer size must be a multiple of a block size (4 bytes on ST25DV).
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Block address in target's EEPROM where to write the data contained in buffer
        buffer - Data to write in increments of 4 bytes within the limit of 4 blocks (16 bytes max on ST25DV)

        STException

      • writeMultipleBlock

        public byte writeMultipleBlock(int blockAddress,
                               int numberOfBlocks,
                               byte[] buffer)
                        throws STException
        Writes the specified number of blocks + 1 of the buffer at the specified EEPROM block address The buffer size must be a multiple of a block size (4 bytes on ST25DV) with a max size of 4 blocks.
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Block address in target's EEPROM where to write the data contained in buffer
        numberOfBlocks - Must be less than MAX_WRITE_MULTIPLE_BLOCKS. The tag will write (numberOfBlocks + 1) blocks in its EEPROM.
        buffer - Data to write in the limit of 4 blocks (16 bytes on ST25DV)
        Returns:
        a status byte
        Throws:
        STException

      • readMailboxMessage

        public byte[] readMailboxMessage(int mbAddress,
                                 int size)
                          throws STException
        Reads data in the tag's MailBox starting at specified location. Fast Transfer Mode must be enabled prior to sending this command.
        Specified by:
        readMailboxMessage in interface FastTransferModeInterface
        Parameters:
        mbAddress - location in the MailBox where to read data (from 0 to MAILBOX_SIZE-1)
        size - number of bytes to read If size = 0 and mbAddress = 0, the command returns ALL bytes available in the mailbox message from the specified location
        Returns:
        data read from the mailbox as a byte array. The first byte returned is the Iso15693 status byte.
        Throws:
        STException - If mbAddress = 0 AND size = 1, a BAD_PARAMETER exception will be thrown as the tag cannot return a single byte from the mailbox at address 0

      • lockConfiguration

        public void lockConfiguration()
                       throws STException
        This command will permanently lock every ST25DV's registers. In that case, it is not possible to change any register anymore by RF. (registers can still be unlocked through I2C command).
        Throws:
        STException

      • killRf

        public void killRf(ST25DVTag.RfManagementMode mode)
            throws STException
        Kill the RF communication of the tag. Two modes are available: - RF_DISABLE : All RF commands will answer with the error 0x0F. - RF_SLEEP : The tag will no more answer to any RF command. NB: RF can be re-enabled through I2C.
        Parameters:
        mode -
        Throws:
        STException
